urlLink The recovery mission goes airbourne, following some intellligence that Zippy may be taking to the air. Gonzalez visits a local Berkshire airforce base to intercept Zippy and guide him home. With Zippy's birthday only days away, things are getting edgy with both Josh and Alice being extremly anxious that Zippy may not find his way home.

Time was running out for Zippy. He had news from the shoe shine man on Canal Street that a search and recover team had been send from Wokingham but so far he had seen no sign. Shiny shoes though, bonus! Taking some time out to think, Zippy contemplated hijacking the helicopter, that way he'd be sure to be home for Tuesday, "about tea time" he pondered "jelly and cream buns". urlLink It was nice to take a break but deep down zippy knew this wasn't the answer, he'd never reach the peddles and anyway where would he land in Ashford ? Time to hit the road again, "a stiff drink and I'll be on my way" he though, "stiff upper lip, on with the show" and on he trudged... urlLink

Alice is pulling no punches as Zippy fails to arrive from Brum. She is seen here briefing Gonzalez on a special forces project to recover Zippy. Although the last pictures showed Zippy in or rather enjoying high spirits, it could be a slippery road from there on. urlLink Alice was heard to assign the following orders to Gonzalez before heading back inside to GHQ. "Gonzales, head up the M40 ASAP and contact GHQ at the earliest opportunity with a positive ID on special agent Zippy. Do not stop until he is no longer MIA. Gonzalez was last seen in Wokingham with no explanation for the detour.
